definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
black hat (worn by feudal official)/fig. official post
to wear a hat/(fig.) to stigmatize/to be branded as
lit. to take off a hat/fig. to be cleared of an unfair charge/rehabilitation
to tag sb with unfair label/power word
gauze hat/(fig.) job as an official
nut (female component of nut and bolt)
the cap of a pen, pencil, or writing brush

sentences.english: I wore this Trilby a lot.
sentences.chinese: 我一直戴着這頂爵士帽。

sentences.english: Learn how to fold an origami samurai hat.
sentences.chinese: 學習如何折一折紙武士帽。

sentences.english: The martingale guy was snapped at the base near the bowsprit cap.
sentences.chinese: 鞅傢伙是結束在基地附近的船首斜桅帽。

sentences.english: He returned to Eagle and removed his helmet in the repressurized cabin .
sentences.chinese: 他回到鷹號在增壓艙摘除宇航帽。

sentences.english: The small battery-powered motor is assembled in the cap, which features a hot foil decoration.
sentences.chinese: 小型電池供電的電動機組裝帽，採用了熱箔裝飾。

sentences.english: And for example flat caps and some coronets, stem from Persia and Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 又如平頂帽和一些頭飾，均來源於波斯和阿富汗。

sentences.english: Did you order your cap and gown?
sentences.chinese: 你訂方頂帽和長袍了嗎？

sentences.english: At our convocation ceremony we all threw our caps in the air.
sentences.chinese: 在我們的畢業典禮上，我們都把學士帽拋到空中。

sentences.english: Either we will take the silver metalized caps or same colour cap like tube.
sentences.chinese: 要麼，我們將採取銀金屬帽或相同顏色的帽像管。

sentences.english: Either we will take the silver metalized caps or same colour cap like tube.
sentences.chinese: 要麼，我們將採取銀金屬帽或相同顏色的帽像管。

sentences.english: In very cold areas a cap, gloves and cotton-padded shoes are required.
sentences.chinese: 在非常寒冷的地區帽，手套和棉鞋是必需的。

sentences.english: The heavy fluted barrel and cap accentuates the elaborate details of this hand crafted writing instrument.
sentences.chinese: 沉重的槽桶帽突出這手牌的製作細節的精心書寫工具。

sentences.english: They also knew his cowboy hat, which he wore every day.
sentences.chinese: 馬也認得他的每天戴着的牛仔帽。

sentences.english: Well, if I had a cool cowboy hat like that.
sentences.chinese: 要是我有這麼帥的牛仔帽。

sentences.english: A. Remove plastic cap from rectal tip, applying more lubricant to tip if needed.
sentences.chinese: 取下肛管頭塑料帽，需要時可在頭上塗潤滑劑。

definition: to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
cloth head covering worn by men in ancient times/headscarf (typically worn by women)/kerchief/turban
to wear a hat/(fig.) to stigmatize/to be branded as
Chinese skullcap resembling the skin of half a watermelon
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
